paper_abstract: We obtain a first non-trivial estimate for the sum of dilates problem in the case of groups of prime order, by showing that if t is an integer different from 0, 1 or -1 and if A subset of Z/pZ is not too large (with respect to p), then vertical bar A + t center dot A vertical bar is significantly larger than 2 vertical bar A vertical bar (unless vertical bar t vertical bar = 3). In the important case vertical bar t vertical bar = 2, we obtain for instance vertical bar A + t center dot A vertical bar >= 2.08 vertical bar A vertical bar - 2.
paper_title: Sums of Dilates in Groups of Prime Order
